flawed_nl_solution:
In the first store, each apple costs $3/6 = $<<3/6=0.5>>0.5.
In the second store, each apple costs $4/10 = $<<4/10=0.33>>0.33.
So, you can save $0.5 - $0.33 = $0.17 on each apple from buying $4 for 10 apples than from $3 for 6 apples.
In cents, this is equal to $0.17 x 100 = <<0.17*100=17.14>>17.14.
